summary: This document is an email chain from October 2020, forwarding earlier August 2019 emails regarding the privilege review process for materials seized from Jeffrey Epstein. It involves discussions between prosecutors and Epstein's defense counsel about sharing Epstein's list of attorneys and implementing a privilege review, with the defense counsel imposing conditions on sharing the list.

persons.name: Marty Weinberg
persons.context: Epstein's defense counsel who is providing Epstein's list of counsel to prosecutors under conditions, including not sharing it with the case team without his consent and implementing a privilege review of seized materials.

persons.name: Michael Miller
persons.context: Assistant U.S. Attorney in the Southern District of New York who is facilitating contact between Epstein's defense counsel and the privilege review coordinator.

persons.name: Reid Weingarten
persons.context: Copied on the email regarding privilege review contact information, suggesting involvement in the legal or privilege review process.

connections.description: Weinberg, as Epstein's defense counsel, is communicating with prosecutor Miller regarding privilege review procedures for seized materials.
Both are attorneys copied on the same email chain discussing privilege review matters related to the Epstein case.

events.title: Privilege Review Contact Initiated
events.description: Assistant U.S. Attorney Michael Miller emails Marty Weinberg and Michael Miller to connect them with the privilege review coordinator, facilitating the provision of privilege-related information.

events.title: Defense Counsel Imposes Conditions
events.description: Marty Weinberg reaches out to prosecutors, offering to provide Epstein's list of counsel under conditions: not sharing it with the case team without his consent and implementing a privilege review of seized materials.

keyFacts: Epstein's defense counsel, Marty Weinberg, agreed to provide Epstein's list of attorneys to prosecutors only under strict conditions, including not sharing it with the case team without his consent.
The defense insisted on implementing a privilege review of materials seized from Epstein, with the FBI's view noted that photos may not need such a review initially.
The email chain highlights procedural negotiations between prosecution and defense regarding the handling of potentially privileged materials in the Epstein investigation.
